title: Duty of liquidator to call meetings of company and of creditors at end of each year
content: 282.- (1) In the event of the winding up continuing for more than one year, the liquidator shall summon a general meeting of the company and a meeting of the creditors at the end of the first year from the commencement of the winding up, and of each succeeding year, or at the first convenient date within three months from the end of the year or such longer period as the registrar of companies may allow, and shall lay before the meetings an account of his acts and dealings and of the conduct of the winding up during the preceding year. 4 of 166 of 1987. (2) If the liquidator fails to comply with this section, he shall be liable to a fine not exceeding eighty-five euros. Final meeting and dissolution.
